description: Real-time system performance monitoring for server

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    'server' as "metric",
    CASE 
        WHEN recent_ping.last_ping IS NULL 
             OR recent_ping.last_ping < $__timeFrom() 
        THEN 0  -- Server is down (no recent ping)
        ELSE 1  -- Server is up (recent ping received)
    END as "value"
FROM (
    -- Get the most recent ping for servers within selected time range
    SELECT 
        MAX(timestamp) as last_ping
    FROM system_metrics 
    WHERE server_name IS NOT NULL
      AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
) recent_ping
SELECT ROUND(AVG(cpu_percent), 1) as "Server CPU %" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND server_name IS NOT NULL
SELECT ROUND(AVG(memory_percent), 1) as "Server Memory %" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND server_name IS NOT NULL
SELECT ROUND(AVG(disk_percent), 1) as "Server Disk %" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND server_name IS NOT NULL
SELECT MAX(uptime_seconds) as "Server Uptime" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND host_name = 'server'
SELECT ROUND(AVG(cpu_temperature_celsius), 1) as "Server CPU Temperature" FROM system_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) AND host_name = 'server' AND cpu_temperature_celsius IS NOT NULL

WITH uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name = 'server'
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY timestamp
),
reboot_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 3600  -- Significant drop
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_reboot_time
  FROM reboot_candidates
),
filtered_reboots AS (
  SELECT timestamp
  FROM reboot_events
  WHERE prev_reboot_time IS NULL  -- First reboot
     OR timestamp > prev_reboot_time + INTERVAL '10 minutes'  -- At least 10 min gap
)
SELECT COUNT(*) as "Total Reboots"
FROM filtered_reboots

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  server_name as metric, 
  AVG(cpu_percent::float) as value 
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  AND server_name IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), server_name
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  server_name as metric, 
  AVG(memory_percent::float) as value 
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  AND server_name IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), server_name
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  server_name as metric, 
  AVG(disk_percent::float) as value 
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  AND server_name IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), server_name
ORDER BY time

WITH latest_server_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (server_name) 
    server_name,
    load_average_1m,
    timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE server_name IS NOT NULL
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY server_name, timestamp DESC
)
SELECT 
  NOW() as time,
  server_name as metric, 
  load_average_1m as value 
FROM latest_server_metrics
ORDER BY server_name;

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  CONCAT(server_name, '_cpu_temp') as metric, 
  AVG(cpu_temperature_celsius::float) as value 
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE server_name IS NOT NULL
  AND cpu_temperature_celsius IS NOT NULL
  AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
  AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), server_name
ORDER BY time

WITH latest_server_metrics AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (server_name) 
    server_name,
    download_mbps,
    upload_mbps,
    timestamp
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE server_name IS NOT NULL
    AND download_mbps IS NOT NULL
    AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
  ORDER BY server_name, timestamp DESC
),
network_data AS (
  SELECT server_name, 'Download' as metric_type, download_mbps as speed FROM latest_server_metrics
  UNION ALL
  SELECT server_name, 'Upload' as metric_type, upload_mbps as speed FROM latest_server_metrics
)
SELECT 
  NOW() as time,
  CONCAT(server_name, ' - ', metric_type) as metric,
  speed as value
FROM network_data
ORDER BY server_name, metric_type ASC;

WITH uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name = 'server'
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY timestamp
),
reboot_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 3600  -- Significant drop
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_reboot_time
  FROM reboot_candidates
),
filtered_reboots AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp as time,
    'reboot' as metric,
    1 as value
  FROM reboot_events
  WHERE prev_reboot_time IS NULL  -- First reboot
     OR timestamp > prev_reboot_time + INTERVAL '10 minutes'  -- At least 10 min gap
)
SELECT 
  time,
  metric,
  value
FROM filtered_reboots
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp) as time, 
  server_name as metric, 
  AVG(disk_write_mb_per_sec::float) as value 
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE server_name IS NOT NULL
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('minute', timestamp), server_name
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
    ROUND(
        LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 3600.0) / 24.0 * 100), 2
    ) as "Daily Availability %"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
    ROUND(
        LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 86400.0) / 7.0 * 100), 2
    ) as "Weekly Availability %"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
    ROUND(
        LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 86400.0) / 30.0 * 100), 2
    ) as "Monthly Availability %"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
    ROUND(
        LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 86400.0) / 365.0 * 100), 2
    ) as "Yearly Availability %"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
    ROUND(uptime_seconds / 3600.0, 1) as "Daily Uptime (hours)"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
    ROUND(uptime_seconds / 86400.0, 1) as "Weekly Uptime (days)"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
    ROUND(uptime_seconds / 86400.0, 1) as "Monthly Uptime (days)"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT 
    ROUND(uptime_seconds / 86400.0, 1) as "Yearly Uptime (days)"
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 1;

WITH uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as row_num
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name = 'server'
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY timestamp
),
reboot_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 3600  -- Significant drop
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    uptime_drop,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_reboot_time
  FROM reboot_candidates
),
filtered_reboots AS (
  SELECT *
  FROM reboot_events
  WHERE prev_reboot_time IS NULL  -- First reboot
     OR timestamp > prev_reboot_time + INTERVAL '10 minutes'  -- At least 10 min gap
)
SELECT COUNT(*) as "Reboots in Selected Period"
FROM filtered_reboots

WITH uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as row_num
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name = 'server'
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY timestamp
),
reboot_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 3600  -- Significant drop
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    uptime_drop,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_reboot_time
  FROM reboot_candidates
),
filtered_reboots AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp as time,
    'reboot' as metric,
    1 as value
  FROM reboot_events
  WHERE prev_reboot_time IS NULL  -- First reboot
     OR timestamp > prev_reboot_time + INTERVAL '10 minutes'  -- At least 10 min gap
)
SELECT 
  time,
  metric,
  value
FROM filtered_reboots
ORDER BY time

WITH uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name = 'server'
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY timestamp
),
reboot_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 3600  -- Significant drop
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_reboot_time
  FROM reboot_candidates
),
filtered_reboots AS (
  SELECT timestamp
  FROM reboot_events
  WHERE prev_reboot_time IS NULL  -- First reboot
     OR timestamp > prev_reboot_time + INTERVAL '10 minutes'  -- At least 10 min gap
)
SELECT COUNT(*) as "Total Reboots"
FROM filtered_reboots

WITH uptime_analysis AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    LAG(uptime_seconds) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_uptime
  FROM system_metrics 
  WHERE host_name = 'server'
    AND timestamp >= $__timeFrom()
    AND timestamp <= $__timeTo()
  ORDER BY timestamp
),
reboot_candidates AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    uptime_seconds,
    prev_uptime,
    (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) as uptime_drop
  FROM uptime_analysis
  WHERE prev_uptime IS NOT NULL 
    AND prev_uptime > uptime_seconds
    AND (prev_uptime - uptime_seconds) > 3600  -- Significant drop
),
reboot_events AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp,
    LAG(timestamp) OVER (ORDER BY timestamp) as prev_reboot_time
  FROM reboot_candidates
),
filtered_reboots AS (
  SELECT 
    timestamp as time,
    'reboot' as metric,
    1 as value
  FROM reboot_events
  WHERE prev_reboot_time IS NULL  -- First reboot
     OR timestamp > prev_reboot_time + INTERVAL '10 minutes'  -- At least 10 min gap
)
SELECT 
  time,
  metric,
  value
FROM filtered_reboots
ORDER BY time

SELECT 
    server_name as "Server",
    TO_CHAR(timestamp, 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS') as "Last Update",
    uptime_seconds as "Uptime (seconds)",
    ROUND(uptime_seconds / 3600.0, 2) as "Uptime (hours)",
    ROUND(uptime_seconds / 86400.0, 2) as "Uptime (days)",
    
    -- Daily calculation (24h)
    ROUND(LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 3600.0) / 24.0 * 100), 2) as "Daily % (24h)",
    ROUND(24 - (uptime_seconds / 3600.0), 2) as "Daily Downtime (h)",
    
    -- Weekly calculation (7d)
    ROUND(LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 86400.0) / 7.0 * 100), 2) as "Weekly % (7d)",
    ROUND(7 - (uptime_seconds / 86400.0), 2) as "Weekly Downtime (d)",
    
    -- Monthly calculation (30d)
    ROUND(LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 86400.0) / 30.0 * 100), 2) as "Monthly % (30d)",
    ROUND(30 - (uptime_seconds / 86400.0), 2) as "Monthly Downtime (d)",
    
    -- Yearly calculation (365d)
    ROUND(LEAST(100, (uptime_seconds / 86400.0) / 365.0 * 100), 2) as "Yearly % (365d)",
    ROUND(365 - (uptime_seconds / 86400.0), 2) as "Yearly Downtime (d)"
    
FROM system_metrics 
WHERE host_name = 'server'
  AND $__timeFilter(timestamp)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC 
LIMIT 5;

title: System Server Monitoring
